intro: Chamaesyce ruizlealii, commonly known as the Ruizleal's sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, mat-like formations, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
